trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Permissions
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Permissions

trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Permissions
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Permissions

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB REST API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB REST API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: This document outlines the REST operations used to manage user permissions for <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This document outlines the REST operations used to manage user permissions for <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A permission is an authorization token associated with a user for authorized access to a specific resource.
trans-unit.target: A permission is an authorization token associated with a user for authorized access to a specific resource.

trans-unit.source: It is used to manage access to collections, documents, attachments, stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions for a particular user.
trans-unit.target: It is used to manage access to collections, documents, attachments, stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions for a particular user.

trans-unit.source: You can associate only one permission to a particular resource for a user.
trans-unit.target: You can associate only one permission to a particular resource for a user.

trans-unit.source: For example, MarketingCollection with _rid xynsa== can only be associated with one permission for user JanetSmith@contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, MarketingCollection with _rid xynsa== can only be associated with one permission for user JanetSmith@contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: An attempt to add another permission to MarketingCollection for Janet results in an error (409 Conflict).
trans-unit.target: An attempt to add another permission to MarketingCollection for Janet results in an error (409 Conflict).

trans-unit.source: There are only two permission modes, <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: There are only two permission modes, <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> mode provides read, write, and delete access to a resource.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> mode provides read, write, and delete access to a resource.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference> mode provides read only access to a resource.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference> mode provides read only access to a resource.

trans-unit.source: A resource token is created every time a GET, PUT, or POST is performed on a permission.
trans-unit.target: A resource token is created every time a GET, PUT, or POST is performed on a permission.

trans-unit.source: By default, the validity period of a resource token is 1 hour.
trans-unit.target: By default, the validity period of a resource token is 1 hour.

trans-unit.source: The validity period can be overridden to up to 5 hours.
trans-unit.target: The validity period can be overridden to up to 5 hours.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a permission:
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a permission:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name that identifies the permission, i.e. no two permissions will share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> within a user.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name that identifies the permission, i.e. no two permissions will share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> within a user.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: permissionMode
trans-unit.target: permissionMode

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The access mode on the resource for the user: <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The access mode on the resource for the user: <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> provides read, write, and delete access to a resource.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>All</parameterReference> provides read, write, and delete access to a resource.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference> restricts the user to read access on the resource.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Read</parameterReference> restricts the user to read access on the resource.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The full addressable path of the resource associated with the permission.
trans-unit.target: The full addressable path of the resource associated with the permission.

trans-unit.source: For example, dbs/ruJjAA==/colls/ruJjAM9UnAA=/.
trans-unit.target: For example, dbs/ruJjAA==/colls/ruJjAM9UnAA=/.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a <externalLink><linkText>system generated property</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/#system-vs-user-defined-resources</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This is a <externalLink><linkText>system generated property</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/#system-vs-user-defined-resources</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the permission resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the permission resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: _token
trans-unit.target: _token

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated resource token for the particular resource and user.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated resource token for the particular resource and user.
